Really great prof with a fun and innovative teaching style! Deliverables are fair and spread out with weekly assignments and/or quizzes, Mid term, final exam, and group project! Course content is interesting and relatable and he's a fun guy to talk to. Only issue is his communication via email; takes forever to get back to students! Easy A!

Prof Mulvey is an extremely knowledgeable and chill prof, and he tries his best to make lectures interesting. Gives good insight on the group project too if you ask him directly. He does takes a really long time to mark things so don't expect to get marks back quickly. Exams are straight forward and heavily based on the textbook. Nice guy.

Prof Mulvey is amazing during the pandemic, he's easily best streamer I had since the start of online class. Very interesting and replies to all the comments; just like a twitch stream but on consumer behavior
Really interesting professor but you've got to be there in class because he gives hints for course deliverables and is likely to help you out more than someone that doesn't show up to class.

Mulvey is super passionate about his field. His grading is really fair. I definitely recommend reading the textbook if you have time. He's an awesome guy and I would definitely take another course with him.

Professor Mulvey is one of the real gems of the Telfer faculty. He's a great lecturer, is extremely knowledgeable and super captivating. Deliverables: Group project / presentation (not very hard), midterm & final exam (straight-forward) Overall: Go to class (or don't), read the textbook and you'll be good. Just take his class, he's the best.

He makes the class more interesting with videos, knows a lot about consumer behaviour and is very proud of that. The group project has very unclear grading criteria, left up to students to decide what to do. Had a midterm on Oct 8th and still haven't gotten the grades back (Dec 5) so have fun not knowing what you have going into final!

Professory Mulvey is such a great guy. Everything he talks about in class actually helps one understand the content. He is super nice and will try his best to help anyone who goes to ask for help during his office hours.
Nice professors always available for student. He knows what he's talking about. Unfortunately, his power point is mostly unrelated to the exam. You have to buy the text book and read it.

He has a slick presentation, but he is all style and no substance. He is very lazy: he doesn't respond to emails, is painfully slow to grade assignments, doesn't provide materials in a timely fashion, and his examples & slides are dated by 10-25 years. We are about to submit our third assignment & he still hasn't graded the first two.
He hardly reply to your emails. He is extremely  difficult to contact, DO NOT let him tell you otherwise. Assignments have unclear guideline and criteria. Dodge if you can.
One of the best professors I've had. He makes course material interesting and can apply to course material.

In my four years, Mulvey is by far the best professors I have ever had. Lectures are not only inspirational, but also extremely memorable. While you do need to (seriously) study for his exams and do your readings, it is all worth it in the end. You and your peers will love going to class.

What an amazing professor. Hands down one of the best Telfer profs Ive had. Mulvey cares about his students and has so much marketing experience and knowledge to pass on. His lectures are super engaging and he is a fair marker. WE LOVE YOU MULVEY!

Mulvey is legendary. His lectures are so engaging you forget you're at school. Funny, smart, interesting guy who really knows his stuff. The class is hard but you'll be happy you took it. One of my greatest experiences at university thus far. Also: read the book!
Amazing professor, one of the best professors at Telfer.  Amazing lectures, incorporates videos and class discussion.  Exams are very fair.  Highly recommend this class!
awesome prof. super interesting and genuinely cares. very engaging.

Awesome prof! Knows how to keep your attention and makes class interesting! Go to class because he shows videos and asks about them on exams. Read textbook because if you only study from slides, there's nothing. He only elaborates more in class.

Amazing professor! His lectures were really entertaining, and he definitely conveyed the subject material in a way that captivated our class. Midterm was a little tricky, but IT DOESN'T EVEN MATTER CAUSE HE'S THE BEST. This guy is AWESOME!

Professor Mulvey is definitely the best marketing prof at Telfer. He explains things well and his lectures are really engaging. Make sure you memorize the textbook for the midterm and final as they are pretty tricky.

He is an excellent professor. Loves to teach, he's funny, and gives good explanations. The course is very challenging, and to do well, you must read your textbook thoroughly and attend lectures. You have  several little assignments and a presentation, along with a midterm and final. I would recommend the course though, if you don't mind a challenge
very interesting prof and keeps you interested in what he's saying.
He provides a stimulating environment which keeps me awake and aware during his class. He also has a great sense of humour and makes marketing fun

Great prof! He really cares about his students and he will go out of his way to make sure you do well in the course. Passionate about what he teaches. Make sure to read the textbook - he really uses it for midterms and exams.

BEST CLASS I HAVE EVER TAKEN. BEST PROFESSOR. His classes are really entertaining and he tries his best to make us all laugh at his jokes :) his slides are very helpful and the videos are very interesting. the midterm and exam are really fair. GREAT PROF.

Takes a different approach to lectures. Shows alot of videos and rambles about marketing as a whole rather than teaching from the textbook. Do not need to attend his classes as his lectures are not reflective of the midterm or final at all. Study the textbook and you'll get a good grade

Great Prof, Down to Earth, overall excellent experience taking his class; Cream of the crop when it comes to University profs.. You HAVE to go to class if you want to really benefit from the Mulvey experience. He cares about students and is very passionate about marketing. I switched out of 3318 to take 3321 solely because Mulvey is the prof!

Bes professor ever. I made it to every class and it was like settling in for my favourite TV show. Engaging and interesting! Be sure to READ THE BOOK as the midterm/exam don't really cover what is is said in class; his lectures are meant to build upon the textbook material. It really pays off in the final exam...

Great prof and very passionate/enthusiastic about his subject. If you genuinely have an interest in marketing and consumer behaviour, then this is the prof to take it with. He finds many ways to try and engage you. Seize it, do the work, and you'll do well!

He is easily the best professors I've had, especially at Telfer. His dedication, overall attitude, and committment to his teaching is admirable. He is so passionate about consumer behaviour that it makes you want to pursue it as well. Thank you professor Mulvey, you've enriched my studies! Study hard for exams, pick a good group, ask many questions

Best teacher I've had so far. His lectures are so interesting and he truly gives you a beyond-the-theory insight about marketing while using his own life experiences and applicable knowledge. Sincerely wants to help you with your future and is always available for questions. One of the only classes that I cannot miss purely for entertainment sake.
Professor Mulvey keeps class interesting using interesting slides, stories and videos.  He is very knowledgeable about marketing and will change the way you read a magazine or watch tv.

Prof. Mulvey is easily one of the best prof's I've encountered in both my undergrad and MBA studies.  He is one of the rare instructors that challenges himself to improve his teaching.  It was a pleasure to be in his MBA marketing class.
BEST_TEACHER_EVER

Although marketing is not part of my favourite interest, Prof. Mulvey teachs his stuff in such an interesting way that you even don't want to skip any class. Clearly, he is extremly knowledgeable and he also knows to convey this knowledge to students. He is the best prof I have ever had! You have to work, but it is really worth it!

He's a great professor, funny and enjoyable. His exams are not HARD, but require studying and basic knowledge of the subject. He shows a lot of ad clips/video clips to convey the subject matter (very interesting). He actually cares about us, and our future sucess. I would recommend him to anyone interested in Marketing. He knows whats he's saying.

Absolutely the best teacher I have had at UofO. He puts so much time and effort into his presentations.  Mulvey has a way of making you want to do well.  He is very knowledgeable.  He demands alot from you as we are obtaining "higher education" so be ready to read your text and study hard to do well.  Take a course with him, you won't regret it!!

Hard exams. It's a waste of time because we are going through the book. Lots of concepts. I looked forward to this class and I am disapointed. Questions on marketing are gone through on a superficial level, no insights.
He has the most enjoyable lectures ever!  Be ready to read the book on your own though to learna  lot fo the concepts.  Well worth it though.

Mulvey is one of my favourite profs at UofO.  His lectures are very entertaining - he loves showing ad clips to reinforce concepts.  Very smart guy but a hard marker though.  Also he should put up his slides before class so students can take notes on them.

This is by far the best reacher i've had in university. This si the first class that i've actually done more work than required because it is so interesting. This man can tell a story like no one else. If you have the chance to take a class with him do it
Has high standards. Not a course for slackers.
Great lectures--can make the most boring and trivial marketing concepts seem exciting.  Personable and funny, an excellent educator all around.

Professor Quadir consistently goes the extra mile for students in his great preparation of materials and examples. He does the job extremely well and I am so fortunate to have him as my teacher for Stats 2. I strongly recommend taking Statistics courses with him.

Professor Tanvir really tries to make sure students do well in his class. He uploaded videos and resources such as assignment/test guides which showed how to complete the work properly. He also was always accessible via email, after class and office hours for questions. I will never take a stats class again but if I had to it would be with Tanvir!

His assignment basically give you answers meaning they should be easy. 4/6 Mc quizzes 5Q each are an easy 10% if you attend class. Midterms and Final are pretty much answers that are given in his study review session. He shows the type of qs how to approach the q and the criteria on how they grade the questions. He is a great prof. Don't avoid.

Great prof for intro to stats. Go to class/watch the lectures, do the homework, and textbook learning checks, they cover exactly what you need to know. Very reasonable guy. I never asked him questions in class, but he was always willing to answer questions during the 10 minute break in class. Oh also, class ends 10-30 minutes sometimes.

Not a single negative thing to say about this dude. Does a phenomenal job explaining concepts, his midterms are super easy, and his exams are a little on the tough side. He has a bit of an accent which makes it difficult to hear sometimes but he makes it up for it by making sure all his students learn and understand concepts thoroughly.
Honestly, very fair professor, teaches very well, super nice and understanding, as long as you process the lectures and do a little bit of practice, you will do amazing.

Super helpful prof, many evaluations and resources so you can practice.  I didn't go to class, just read the textbook, practiced the exercices, and watched the recordings he posts if I felt I needed clarification.  Hate math and I enjoyed this stats class. Great textbook, very clear grading guidelines. It's clear he wants students to succeed. 10/10

Very caring professor which will make recordings of the in-person lectures for students to review. Midterm and final exam are not hard if you listen to his review session carefully. I didn't spend much time in this course but I got A-, i am satisfied with it and the professor.
Amazing prof! Explains the topic very well for a course with hard content. Midterm and Exam were very fair questions. Would take him again
Hands down the best prof Ive had so far! If youre taking a stats course make sure you choose him

He is someone who cares about the success of his students. His lectures are fast-paced, but if you pay attention and take notes, you'll find that he explains the content very well. His courses are planned well, and he provides practice questions with answers for each chapter.

Amazing prof! Clear explanations and lectures.. responds very fast to emails and always goes through the assignment questions in lectures and explains how to solve them Lots of practice problems and review material to prep for exams. Exams are fair imo (some hard questions here and there but overall no surprises) without too many surprises

Take this course with this professor. always there to help with the assignments which are worth a good deal combined so go to office hours and ask him questions after the lectures. Attend any exam review sessions the ones he hosts will help you lots. Great professor who cares a lot about the students in his class, probably the best one to take.
amazing guy. 5/5 he is great and always willing to help
I am stupid, but he makes me understand hard stat content.

Really good prof! He explains the topic clearly, and provides all of the ressources necessary to do well in his class such as practice questions, past midterms and exams. He is very understanding and is available to answers students' questions.

Honestly I love stats and Professor Tanvir is a good professor but because of the asynchronous lectures I just felt like I was teaching myself. Also 80% of his test questions are found online or on Chegg.

after doing really well in stats I, i thought this class would be a breeze - the prof, unfortunately, just didn't work for me. he was persistently late to class, went over the allotted time, and wasn't very clear on content that probably could have been better taught with a textbook. the workload was also heavy: 3 quizzes, 2 assignments, 2 tests

his teaching style didn't really work for me, I like having a full picture of what it is that I'm doing, and a lot of the time I felt confused in this class. His assignments and quizzes are pretty fair and well-composed. I also like the quizzes on Brightspace because they allow me to make sure I'm on track. He also provides a formula sheet.

He's a really amazing stats prof! The bad ratings don't do him justice as the only reason he goes over sometimes is to make sure you understand the content! Like if you don't want that, just leave the lecture. He goes out of his way to help you, especially with assignments, and all his grading is very fair. 100% recommend!

I loved 2106 and was excited for stats but then I took this class. Although easy, the classes are so hard to pay attention to. I was so reliant on the TA. The lectures made me want to sleep. I felt like all of the quizzes were very different from what was learned in class and the practice questions. Get any other prof if you can!

This is so frustrating, as he is extremely disorganized. He goes way too fast and his problems usually aren't clear/miss information. This just adds more confusion to the content. He also sometimes seems like he's fed up when you ask him an "easy" question.

I don't doubt Tanvir is great in other courses but DO NOT take him for PSY2116. I thought it wouldn't be too bad considering the prof I had for 2106 but I was wrong. I cannot pay attention to lectures, I don't know what to write down, he goes so fast but slow at the same time. His classes bordered on 1h40 on average. Do not take for online PSY2116

Loved this teacher. Stats is so heavy and although his lectures were long and sorta monotone, if you really pay attention and take notes your bound to get a good mark. He provides practice questions every chapter and "PDQ" sheets (like a memory aid that you can use during tests and exam). Awesome teacher highly recommend if you're scared of stats.

Professor Quadir is one of the best professors I've ever had! He cares about his students deeply and wants them to succeed. His explanations were AMAZING, he talks slowly and makes sure to really engrave the concept in your brain. 10/10 would recommend you take his class if you're not the best at math because he will simplify everything.

Love this man. The lectures were a little boring, I always had to put them on 2x speed. However, he is such a nice person. His tests are easy. He really cares about his students and wants us to succeed. He even compared the two classes and realized the TA messed up and compensated us, which never happens btw. Hes a gem.

This prof always put in a lot of effort to help students fully understand concepts and evaluations. Definitely cares about his students' success. I found the lectures to be slightly boring, but it is math after all. Overall you can't go wrong with this prof he's very good.

i wish all profs were like him. genuinely cares about his students and his organization and effort shows. dedicates so much time, will answer all your questions, and guide you step by step through assignments. more content heavy than the other profs, but def more worth it bc u actually learn material. go to his lectures!!! pace & clarity is insane

This guy was hands down my favourite professor during the semester. He went out of his way to make sure every single detail of the assignments he gave was understood, and made sure to answer every question that was asked. You can tell he truly does care for the success of his students, and if you dont do well, thats definitely on you.

One of the best professors I've had so far. He takes so much time to actually help students out with assignments and concepts before the exam. He wants to make sure we understand and do well which is very much appreciated. Definitely would take his class again.
amazing prof honestly he took out the time to remark all the assignments that the TA didnt mark properly, hes so caring and just wants you to do well, would definitely take him again hes a real gem
He really cares and gives out clear instructions and class material

Professor Quadir is one of the most caring profs I have ever had. He is very accessible after class and he really cares about his students! His in-class quizzes are fairly simple and he provides very clear expectations when it comes to his assignments. Would love to have him again!

This Prof made the harder of the two stats classes a lot more bearable. Went out of his way to ensure all necessary content was provided on the slides. His assignment guidelines were especially useful, as they walked you through what was expected for each question. No suprises on the midterm, and assignments/quizzes are an easy A.

Being in his class is great he explains everything you need to know very well. He is always willing to help out his students. He is very reasonable and approachable if you have any issues or questions. ADM2303 Stats in it self may not be a very interesting course for some of us, but he does as much as he can so that you can do well in the class.
If you have SASS AVOID HIM. He does not give you your rights for accomodations.

His lectures are based entirely on the textbook so make sure you have it, and read the assigned chapters twice over before each exam for a guaranteed A. Exams were all multiple choice which I appreciated, but each midterm is 25% and the final is 50% so keep that in mind. The final is pretty easy if you read the textbook and takes under an hour.
He has a lot of interesting stories that he shares the whole class. He then makes you feel bad for asking questions and then gets mad and makes you feel stupid for asking them. Avoid

Took as an elective. Funniest prof I had last semester. All you need to pass, is to read the top hat textbook a couple times and answer the questions in there. He tells really awesome stories and loves to bike lol. Read the textbook chapter before class so you can focus on the hints he gives you for your MidTerm and Final. Would def take again!

You definitely do need a textbook for this class, all of his lectures are directly from the textbook. His lectures aren't too bad, very simple and straight to the point and he really does help you go through and explain the textbook. He also has some pretty good stories that for once actually do have to do with the class. Overall not too bad.

AVOID. Makes you feel stupid. Insanely hard marker. Doesn't give clear instructions for assignments, then takes off SO many marks. Makes you hand in everything in hard copy then proceeds to write all his comments in chicken scratch so you have no clue what you did wrong. This will be my lowest mark BY FAR. Course content is easy though.

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROF (I don't have enough space to write it all) 
- Made this simple class way to hard
- Unclear instructions (if any) 
- Really hard grader 
- Passive aggressive emails 
- Lectures we disorganized 
- Got mad about all the emails asking for our marks on our final assignment so he didn't give them back till after the exam

Great course - and all of the questions on exams are right out of tophat. He gives really engaging lectures and often tells us funny or inspiring stories about himself. Only downside is that he can be kind of grinchy or unresponsive by email but tbh just ask him in person and he's quite professional then.

A good teacher who wants students to succeed. Sometimes grumpy but loves questions and really wants to help. I would recommend reading the chapters and doing a few problems before class. Then the lecture makes it all make sense. Finish the problems in the textbook after class, practice using the formulas, and you will do well.

Surprised that he has so many good reviews. Really nice guy, bad prof for PSY2106. 3 exams, no chances to bring up your grade. Lectures fast, classes would last 20-30 minutes. Promises formula sheets, and doesn't give them.  Others who are taking the same class with a different prof are offered cheat sheets, and we were not allowed anything.
Beware his grading is scary exam1 25% exam2 25% final 50% not much room for error. He's a funny guy though, lots of stories

Sends lots of passive aggressive emails. Makes you feel like an idiot. Incredibly tough marker BUT gives really poor outlines on what you are meant to be doing. No rubrics for assignments either. (If the entire class did poorly on an assignment maybe it's not just the students at fault? Just a thought.) Chicken scratch handwriting.

avoid at all costs. no instructions what so ever on assignments and then wonders why students are failing but does nothing to fix it. though grader and good luck understanding his feedback. also makes very inappropriate comments.
He is literally so vague. He gives 0 instruction. His lecture contain 0 info. He is also inappropriate at times. AVOID AT ALL COSTS

Great professor in my opinion. If you just read the TopHat textbook and did the midterms you would be fine. Attendance was apparently mandatory but it was essentially the same thing as reading the textbook except he would explain it in his own words and make it more understandable. Lectures were long but worth going if you could. def would take agn
I didn't attend the lectures and simply read the textbooks and got an A+ by doing so. You just have to make sure that you memorize and review well and you're on your way to an A+!

His style of teaching statistics was not what I was expecting (more theory-based than actual calculations) but overall he was a great professor. He was super responsive to my emails and made himself available outside of class within reason. He also provided a lot of opportunities for students to ask questions. Don't bother with the textbook though

If you have the choice I would not choose Victor Emerson as your statistics teacher. A statistics teacher who can barely do the bare minimum to provide for his students. In my opinion, he should retire and become a comedian, his whole class is a joke.

He is a kind professor, I did mostly use the textbook instead of attending lectures since all quizzes were based solely on the interactive textbook. His quizzes and final exam were meh, like it wasn't as easy as my PSY 1101 class, maybe that's just me lol.
Convinced all reviews over 3 are Emerson in disguise, I had him for psy 1101 and he was fine, but don't take him for stats

Most unclear grading criteria I have ever seen. He does not answer emails, or if he does it takes a long time for him to get to them. He expects you to gather additional information and not "simply answer the question" but at an unreasonable scale. He will not offer feedback because he won't let you see your test... Makes this class too difficult.

This prof is very organized and seems fair with his grading. Theres quite a bit of material, but you only need to read the textbook based on whats presented in class. I didnt love the phrasing of his questions (ex: how would you interpret the following with only 1 correct answer), but thats really the only downside. Not a bad choice!

Avoid. The material wasn't too hard but he has a very convoluted way of explaining things. I got an A in PSY 2106 and for this course, I failed the first two midterms. Not even close to enough time for midterms. Class discord talked about reporting him to the department of psychology because we all did so poorly, he also took forever to grade.

I first had him for PSY1102 (A-) and enjoyed his classes so much I chose him again for PSY2106 (B-). Overall, he breaks materials down to make it easier to understand, is fun and nice. He's a caring professor who roots for your success. Take him if you can

Dr. Emerson really "dumbs down" the material and makes statistics really simple to understand. The only thing is that he is not really available outside of class and that he took quite a long time to return the test marks. By far one of the best math professors I had the chance of taking.

If you want an A+ you'll need to work for it and read the textbook in depth. It's easy to get an A/A- if you casually read/attend lectures. The course is divided in 4 quizzes, and a final. The rest were participation marks. The quizzes are harder than the final because of the time limit (about a minute per question).

I loved this class. The prof was very nice and he made the material interesting. I did not go to many lectures because we were only tested on the content in textbook. We had many quizzes and many opportunities to get a good grades.
I didn't attend any lectures and still received an A. you will need the textbook which is on Tophat and is quite pricey. Overall, I'd take it again it was an easy A.
Lectures were always interesting and enjoyable. Professor Emerson is knowledgable and always has a great attitude. He's quite funny and I always look forward to his personal anecdotes.

I didn't attend a single lecture and still did good. 4 quizzes and a final. 12% of your mark is just for reading the textbook/answering questions and participating in a few ISPR questionnaires. Questions from the textbook don't even have to be right, it's for completion. One downside is you cannot see your quiz after to see what you did wrong.

I love him, he's so happy it makes me happy. We had tophat textbook questions that were only marked for completion (but were very helpful practice for the test) due every 2 weeks. 4 tests (on tophat) and a final exam. Not a difficult class at all and his lectures are very interesting, 10/10 would recommend:)
You definitely do not have to attend classes. If you just read the textbook, you will be perfectly fine.

I really enjoyed this class and his lectures complemented the textbook really nicely. Everything on the test is in the textbook (TopHat), which is great. I also liked that he told us personal stories and anecdotes in his lectures - made the class more personal and interesting!

As he said, his lectures are more of a "give you a different perspective" kind of deal. It's not necessary to watch his lectures to get an A. I don't think it added much to my understanding at all. The textbook is shared by all sections and that's all you need.

I stopped attending lectures the day Professor Emerson told us that his lectures were not mandatory. There were often readings with MC questions to do, as well as the heavily graded quizzes. Besides that, when I did attend lectures and paid attention, Professor Emerson always explained everything very well, and also included his own life details.
epic. just need the textbook and youll get a nice, kind, little A+ :)

Amazing & funny! Victor will not answer emails that have previously been answered in class/ on the syllabus. Just like us, he has better things to do. If you're too lazy to read the syllabus then don't ask a question. It's an easy A, took minimal effort. All you need is the textbook. His lectures help if you are confused about anything in the book.
Tbh I did not go to class once. As long as you read the textbook or PowerPoint before each quiz you get an A easily. This professor is impatient, unwilling to answer your question.

This course (taken Fall 2020) was based entirely off the textbook and you didnt have to attend lectures to do well on the quizzes (4) and final exam. However, his lectures are good for understanding any difficult concepts and he does tell lots of stories. Hes quite a knowledgeable man and I found him inspirational as well (youll find out why)!

The material for this class is based exclusively on the textbook which is nice. He used the same pool of questions for the final as he did for the previous tests, but did not give feedback on the tests so good luck figuring out what mistakes you made. Luckily the course is very easy and he seemed like a nice guy too.
long boring slideshows, tells lots of stories during lectures. nice prof but not great with technology. all textbook material so make notes and read the textbook to pass, all quizzes.

Prof Emerson is honestly great. He always made lectures interesting by adding in stories here and there, and he makes it clear what will be on the upcoming quizzes. The whole course is based off the textbook so if you don't attend class but read the corresponding chapter you're fine. Quizzes/final wasn't easy but not too hard either

Victor is a champ. He is so caring and nice and tells a lot of interesting stories. He doesnt read off the slides and tries to make the content more interesting. All the quizzes and exams are based off of the textbook, so no attendance isnt mandatory but his lectures are great.

This class is so easy now being online, all you need to do is real the textbook on tophat and answer the questions. Literally the test questions are the same as the textbook its a joke. The only hard part is the actual concepts but its easy to learn, if that makes sense.
He is super sweet and as long as you keep up with the textbook, the quizzes are super easy.

He is a nice person, could be rude if you ask him questions that are CLEARLY STATED in the syllabus. Using real life example, he did a great job explaining development, social psy and stress and the two chapters on disorders. But, he didn't explain personality clear and that is directly reflected by my quiz mark. Overall, good and easy to succeed.
No need to show up to lectures though I found the ppt slides nice for review purposes. Self-studied course, didn't need the prof at all.

Material is so interesting, if you are going into the healthcare field I recommend this class over PSY 1101 (foundations). I went to two lectures the entire semester, and as someone who never takes naps, fell asleep during both of them. 7 online TopHat chapters, 4 quizzes and just a final. Quizzes and final entirely based on textbook not lectures.

Prof Emerson is pretty good. His lectures weren't compulsory, but I still attended, and it was worth it. Read the textbook because all the quiz material is in it. There are no projects, just four quizzes and 1 final exam, which is 100 multiple-choice questions. It's a fairly easy class, very interesting too! He is very professional and well-spoken.

Prof Emerson is a great guy. He really tries to make the class interesting! The lectures aren't necessary, but I always went because I really liked him. The textbook is a must to read and study because the exams are based on it not the profs lectures.

Very intelligent professor, has lots of excellent stories and great taste in music! He includes useful examples from his personal life and years of experience to illustrate the concepts. He treats students like capable adults, and won't answer questions that can be easily answered by looking at the syllabus. Has a very soothing voice.

20/10 professor. I'm a 4th year student and took this course as an elective. Very entertaining lectures. Probably the most well spoken Professor I have ever had. Very smart man and seems to genuinely care. Makes all of the classes interesting, no matter the content. I highly recommend. Tests are directly related to the course material.

His lectures are way too boring to attend, goes excruciatingly slow and tediously emphasizes points that are pretty trivial. Basic textbook course so all exams were based directly from book, buy it, read it, ace the class. The notes you make yourself from the book are prolly more aesthetic and clear than his. Not a BAD prof, just boring and slow.

I thought Prof. Emerson did a great job at conveying the 1102 material in an interesting way, and did a good job at trying to include relevant examples of his own with the textbook material for it to be easier to remember. It's an information-dense course, but he made it clear which parts were most important to focus on and study for exams.

Professor Emerson does a great job of explaining statistics in a way that can be understood in everyday contexts. He cares about student success and lectures are sometimes funny. I personally found his particular method of presenting stats incompatible. At the same time, expectations are clear - so if you do the tutorials you will be okay.

Emerson's slides were detailed and are a good summary of the textbook. I definitely recommend taking a class with him. Lectures were a bit boring but attendance wasn't mandatory and his midterms are fair. He definitely has experience teaching however he gets annoyed when students ask him questions which "are answered in the course syllabus"

I actually liked the guy, he's really passionate about teaching and loves what he teaches. Midterms are tricky but manageable. For the final exam, try to read the book chapters to understand some realistic scenarios, because the Psych department gives you scenarios, while Emersons' slides more or less gives you definitions.

Very funny and wise man. Favourite prof i've had in university thus far. You don't have to show up to any lectures to do well in the class because the exams are based entirely off of the textbook and he posts all of the slides summarizing the book on brightspace. I still showed up to class simply because I enjoy hearing him lecture.

He talks about his life for 60% of the class, which is kind of interesting but not relevant to the course. You have to read the textbook if you want to do well. If you attend his class, watch out! He will call you out for talking or for looking at your screen too enthusiastically. Don't bother going to class.
He is a great instructor and he is obviously very intelligent. Even though my class is a 7-10, I go every time because the class is super interesting !
Lectures aren't boring, and he knows what he's talking about. Has a wealth of stories and seems to genuinely care.

Dr. Emerson has excellent experience and wisdom. He invests in his students and is willing to give generously. He is organized; you need to book an appointment to see him. Attending his lectures will definitely help with grades but will also help you to learn how to apply psychology in practical life.

In first year Psy, the final exam is based on only the textbook, so you need to do the readings. Victor puts all his lectures online and there is not a lot of other notes you need to take from lectures as they all come from the slides. Exams are multiple choice and super easy if you just read his lecture notes and textbook. Its an easy A class.

Emerson is very approachable. If you find a problem with anything (ie., the exam time), you can voice your concerns to him. He sincerely wants his students to do well and acknowledges some differences between his generation and ours. I wasn't a fan of the material, but I liked him and found it easy to do well (also he provides sample Qs for exams).

4 "tests" (midterms, really)+final. Less than an hour for the first test and an hr for the other 3. No assignments or course work outside the exams which I didn't like. No multiple choice Qs. Textbook not necessary, only useful if you need help learning the content (I regret buying). Optional lab tutorial. Would've rather taken with another prof :/

The course material is based in the text, so just read it. Emmerson picks and chooses certain points from the textbook to ramble about and provide "personal stories" that feel like a waste of time and and also seem to over complicate the structure and delivery of the textbook material. I would not take his course again, lecture are a waste of time
His lectures are good but not necessary to attend easy A if you base your studying off the textbook and the underlined terms in his slides

I went to 4 classes and got a B+ in the course. I personally found his lectures to be interesting, but not worth the time as I could read through the slides faster. Overall though, the course is interesting, and Emerson isn't bad, just not my cup of tea. Would take again, textbook was mandatory for the final.

He's a good prof, but god help you if you speak in class, he will single you out in front of the whole room. But the course is really easy - a lot of course material to cover, so you still need to study hard, but the exams were multiple choice and the expectations are very straightforward (just learn the underlined terms on his slides).
Maybe one of my favourite prof's ever. Absolutely hilarious... you don't NEED to go to class, but he makes it worth while
I love his lectures. Everything he says is clear.

You can skip every class (minus the mid-terms) and only read the textbook and emerge with a good grade. The class doesn't really do much for you besides give you an opportunity to ask questions. He often ends classes early and I wouldn't recommend his 3 hour lectures (they'll kill you). He often gets off topic and tells many personal stories.

Overall not too bad a prof. Wasn't a fan of how almost every class was spent talking about really random stuff that we were never tested on or required to write papers about. He obviously loves to teach because he is 70 and still going strong. Very intelligent man. Loved having one on one conversations with him during office hours.

Very dull prof. Never went to a class after the first midterm because he talked about his own stories more than the course content. Finished with an A+ regardless. Just read the textbook and enhance that material with his slides and you'll pass easily.

Explained stats so well that I already understood the concepts in the second stats class by the time this course was over. Very helpful during office hours and the exams get easier as the semester goes on

Victor Emerson is such a loveable guy! He actually gives you really good hints on what material will be focused more on the midterms and exam if you go to the lectures, and he usually gives a 10 min break every hour and we end by 9:30, which is chill. Don't need to read the textbook, his slides are enough. Loved his music choices and super nice!

if you don't go to any classes and just read the textbook at home, you'll still pass the class with an A. His lectures are extremely hard to follow. I love that he integrates personal experiences, but he reads all the material that is crucial off of the slides and it makes it EXTREMELY hard to focus.

Pretty rude guy, went to office hours to seek help and made me feel like I was a waste of his time. Midterms and exam are all textbook based so read the textbook or you're screwed. Stopped going to the class because he just talks about himself 75% of the class. Read the textbook and you're fine.

seems like a good prof; but doesnt care about his students. The syllabus had a breakdown for marks that included online quizzes, but nowhere in the syllabus did it say where or what the quizzes consisted of, which I asked him about and he said ask the TA, I know nothing about it was shocked that he did not as he should when he is the prof.

He cares a lot about his students and want them to do well in the class. He goes quicky through his lectures, but as long as you read the textbook, practice the equations and do the homework, as well as ask him for help if needed, you should do just fine!

Very nice and funny prof. He is very well organized, everything is very clear. He shows tons of visual examples and is always making sure everyone understands well. Stats is not at all my favourite subject but he makes it enjoyable and interesting with real life examples so you actually understand where the numbers come from.

AMAZING Prof!! He made stats enjoyable, believe me! Sticks around after class and gives you feedback and goes above and beyond to make sure his students understand the material for the tests. 4 tests and a final, no assignments. All of his tests have bonus questions, so get 108% is a thing! He jokes sometimes to make things smoother, take him!!!!
You don't need to go to class. Read the textbook and you'll be fine.

Dr. Emerson was a great prof. I had him for both PSY2116 and PSY2174, both of which were courses that I was not looking forward to. Dr. Emerson is super knowledgeable in both research methods and statistics. His slides are very clear and his explanations in class are excellent. Just sit back and listen in lectures and you'll have a great time.
all his examples are from his personal experience. boring as hell. fell asleep a few times
Very condescending. Lectures are all over the place. Goes over a lot of material very briefly and tests on pointless, specific information.

This prof is old and likes to give examples every two seconds about what life was like in the past. But he shows videos and is pretty hip and i actually love him. On the first day he showed us Eminems music video lol. He goes till about 9:15pm. not all the way to 10 which is good, and you get a 5 min break every hour. Just read the txtbk & ur good.

such a funny guy.. there's no need to take notes. he's very encouraging to ask questions and he answers them wonderfully. go to class with an open mind, don't be afraid to ask the same question 100 times, he'll give 100 different examples.. really amazing prof, 100% recommend!
Just listening to Emerson increases your IQ, no kidding. His grading system is unclear but just make sure you ask him a lot of questions for all your projects.

Statistics is not an easy course and this prof made everything that much harder. You only had 10 minutes to see him during his office hours even if you book an appointment. His lectures are kinda boring, just reads off slides. Do the tutorial questions if you want to pass. Would not take this prof for anything again. Terrible experience.

Really well organized, no surprises. He has lots of experience with research, so lots of great examples. Conveys the subject matter really well, and takes the time to make sure you understand what is being described. He made a stats course fun!

Found this class pretty redundant, as it is entirely textbook based. I only went to class 3 or 4 times, made notes on the textbook and studied the day of the final and still ended up with a good grade. Easy A if you are willing to put in the time to read the textbook.

Professor Emerson is very funny and he's in general a kind man. What i also liked about him is that he would consider the marks you get on the two midterms and assign the heavier weight to the one you did better on. However, sometimes it would be difficult to understand/hear what he is saying. He LOVES when people ask questions. He will pick on you

I guess I just disagree with the general consensus. I thoroughly enjoyed this class, actually felt like he went super slow before exams to force people to try. He would send out emails begging people to send him questions so he could address them. Pretty straightforwards concepts and he really cares about the students.

Had him for Psy1102 and Psy2174. His lectures are very boring. Class midterms for Psy2174 were appalling, average was 42% for 1 section and 51% for the other. Went into statistics on how it was not his fault that the class did poorly. Exams did not reflect course material.

Dr Emerson is a funny professor, and this course is pretty easy but make sure you read the chapters in the textbook!!! The exam is entirely textbook based, and it was tougher than the two midterms. Study ahead of time so you can memorize little details and facts.
I struggled in this course but honestly he is an amazing prof. Lectures often ended early which was nice.  He doesn't drag things out, right to the point. Very funny, made the class enjoyable.

You have to basically memorize the textbook in order to pass this class which is a lot. Theres only 2 midterms and the exam, all of which are multiple choice. The classes aren't mandatory because the exams and midterms are based off the textbook, not the lecture notes.
Emerson is amazing!!! He has the best stories. Keep doing you boo!
always funny stories!
Awesome Prof! He made stats some what interesting! Understanding and very approachable. He doesn't deal with laziness which I loved. I am very fortunate to have him a second time.

Emerson will teach you to apply critical reasoning skills, be inquisitive about the world and to think 'outside of the fishbowl'. Lectures influence assignments which influence exams. Provides help at his office hours. VERY SPECIFIC MARKER, deducts marks for minor flaws and details in definition as well as for 'misinterpreted questions'.

Might be one of my favourite profs of all time. Funny and always has your best interest at heart. I enjoyed his lectures. This could have been an extremely boring class, he made if fun, interesting, and I actually enjoyed doing the projects. How he managed to do that I will never know but seriously I hope I take another class with him as my prof.
Extremely sarcastic but cracked me up all semester. He likes it when you challenge him which I think is fun. It was a required course for me and I was dreading taking it but he made it not so bad.

This was the worst class Ive ever taken...  Heard it was an easy A, but from who? I went for help and I felt like an idiot after, not because I should have known what I was doing but because he was condescending... He told me it wasn't his job to help me, but a TA...

Literally such a good prof. If you go to his office hours he is extremely helpful, and clear about what to do on assignments. People posting reviews otherwise obviously never asked for help. Posts slides and gives sample exam questions that are EXTREMELY accurate to the exam Grading can be tough but mostly fair. Would definitely take him again :)

Had him for stats and research. He spent an entire class going over the midterm. If you did better on the final he made your midterm worth 10% instead. All of the exam questions come from the samples and tutorials. STUDY THEM. His assignments are vague but you can see him & he'll review your assignment for you. Participation  know lecture material

This prof!!! Is a ridiculous!!! grader!!! Went in expecting a GPA boost and came out with a mild case of PTSD. Do not be deceived by the friendly old man look - say goodbye to your grades. Lectures are dry. Will not help you if you go to office hours. Become good friends with your TA for this class or expect to cry.

Psychology students beware. I had him for Research Methods and Ethics, and let me tell you - I've never experienced a prof that could make such an EASY course so PAINFUL. He has surprise pop quizzes which count for attendance, and his marking criteria for midterms and exams is close to impossible. Start crying in advance.

He's a terrible proff. Do not take him for research methods! His lectures aren't representative of his exams... neither is the textbook. He is condescending, seems nice, however he is actually very difficult as a person. It was more of a non-applicable statistics class if anything. BEWARE of his exams, he is a very tough grader.

Really nice guy, and won't put you to sleep during lectures. However, everything is in the book and no additional knowledge is need, especially since the faculty makes the final on the book. Read the book and maybe look over his notes, and theres no reason not to get an easy A.

Assignments are confusing, doesn't do a good job explaining them. Tests appear easy, but he marks them insanely hard, I studied and attended class, half the class failed the midterm. Marks for particpation, unfortunately. He's losing his touch, it was tougher than it should have been?

Great research prof, midterms exams are EASY. the TA is very hard marker.. they will always find errors in your questionnaires and surveys. A 70% on the assignments is about the avg to good grade and the midterms will help you but there not worth much. YOU NEED TO GO TO THE TUTORIALS IN ORDER TO DO WELL ON THE ASSIGNMENTS.

Emerson really knows how to teach. He is able to give relatable real-world examples, and will not hesitate to spend extra time in lectures to review a concept. Encourages you to see him in office hours (and I highly suggest doing so!). Marking scheme on exams is confusing and sometimes unfair. Otherwise, very good prof.

Emerson is THE BEST. Not only is he super hilarious and relatable, but his exams are SUPER easy if you attend class. You don't even really need the textbook, everything he tests is on his slides. 100% reccommend if you want an easy A :). Love ya Emerson

Overall, a better than average prof. This course would have been very easy if it weren't for the lack of clarity given for assignments. Despite this, the exams were very fair and were almost more of a test of your intelligence than your ability to memorize. Textbook is optional.

Easiness: This prof tells you what you need to know if you actually pay attention. Exams are reasonable and easy. Assignments seem difficult due to the way T.A.s grade.. typical. Helpfulness: Willing to go over the midterm with students. Provides forum discussions as an extra option for the class participation grade. Clarity: Exams 5/5 Assign. 2/5.
Although he's a very sweet man and very knowledgeable, his class was really boring. Very easy to pass if you do the readings though!

Participation s worth 10%. If you're shy or don't like asking questions in front of the class, you're pretty much screwed. He gives his slides online, but they are long and have a lot of irrelevant information that you won't be tested on. The tutorials were kind of useless to me. He's okay, but you can probably get a better mark with another prof.

soooooo boring. ambiguous instructions for assignments. Will teach material and then tell you in the final review class "you don't need to know anything about that except that it exists". He expects you to read the whole book. I did ok in this class (B+), but I feel that I could have achieved a higher grade with a different prof.

His exams were very fair, but he was pretty vague about assignment expectations and the rubric was not very detailed. He didn't seem to like answering questions and was always in a hurry during his office hours which was frustrating. The tutorials were useful.

You can get a good mark by not ever going. Exams based entirely on textbook, lectures complete regurgitation of textbook. Boring, not engaging, reads slides word for word, goes off on tangents about his life stories that have very little to do with the class. Difficult to reach outside class hours. Quiet, monotone voice.

I did not like his teaching style at all. Only 1/4 of the class ever attends lectures. His lectures are just packed with his examples and life stories. I would recommend studying the textbook! I found the midterms specific and difficult but the final is entirely based on the text book

Research methods and ethics was a very difficult class when taken with him. He over complicated the material A LOT. He taught us a lot of unnecessary material that other sections of the same course were not covering. He is not friendly as a person and is very condescending. He will not answer questions and participation is worth 10%.

Although attendance isn't mandatory, he does take 10% for participation (actually asking questions and answering questions). Very personable outside of class and attempts to make the class funny although the topics are fairly dry. Marking is okay but takes off a lot of marks if one word is missed so be detailed oriented.

Really wasn't looking forward to stats but got Emerson and it was great! Easy exams if you keep on top of stuff, so just don't get behind and don't be shy to ask for clarification cuz it will cost you in the long run. 10/10

for such a boring topic, i loved the class! hes really helpful and if you stay ontop of things and pay attention, youll do great. i didnt attend 1 tutorial nor did i take any notes and im nottttt a good student usually. hes simply funny and helpful and makes stats as 'fun' as they can be and i highly recommend him. he talks about toesnails a lot.

Gives 10% to participation but is very unclear about the meaning of "participation". One person out of 60 got 10/10. Everyone else was graded in comparison to that person. 15 people got 0/10 because they spoke very little. Meanwhile the one asking questions and useless comments every 5 seconds gets the highest grade. Dropped from a B+ to a C+.
Great prof! Very helpful.Yes his exams are not always easy, but this is a class at a university level. Be prepared to work and learn; or don't take this class.

1102- Makes things more complicated than needed. Teaches his own crap and then you're unprepared for final by the dean. 2106- Study, study, study the textbook. Take it with someone else. his 40 minute exams suck. no equation sheet. Short answers worth 30 mrks. His grading makes no freaking sense. DONT DO IT or Research Methods with him either!

He made stats better than it could have been! Although his test questions can be a little abstract & there is a 40min time limit, getting great marks is definitely do-able. You have to work hard and do lots of practice questions! He is a really great stats prof and I am so thankful I had this course with him! He knows his stuff!

Take this class seriously and read the textbook and do the examples. You have to prepare yourself for anything because his expectations are often unclear. He responds quickly to your emails and will gladly meet with you even outside of office hours. He also loves when you ask questions... so don't be shy. Take advantage of this!
he's quite good!
Good person, but exams were difficult. I felt that the lectures were very boring...

Excellent erudite professor.Provides clear and well organized slides.Open atmosphere in class.Good balance between teaching and amount of humor.Midterm 1 was fair, m.t.2 more fair, but a level to be expected in a university.You'll do well if you study.Has a heart for the students,very helpful.Lot of learning in a richly created environment! A+
Great prof; makes jokes during lectures to try and keep things interesting, explains things clearly and is very helpful. The only things is, his midterms and final exam are difficult.

Funny guy. Makes lectures as interesting as the material allows, and is always open to comments or ideas to improve his teaching. Enjoys teaching and is very knowledgeable. Definitely a good prof - would recommend! Exams can be tricky, as the wording is quite specific and can change the meaning ever so slightly. Be careful and you should be fine.

Prof. McKenna is by far and away the worst prof I've had so far. He was rude to students who emailed him with questions. Fully ignored the bio component of bioethics, so if you looking to take a philosophy class he's your guy. His TAs marks harshly and doesnt respond well to feedback. Also, he offered us a chance for extra credit and never gave it

He just rambles on for the whole class and leaves it to the students to have an open discussion, which I suppose makes sense for a philosophy teacher, but most of the people who take this class are enrolled in a science program, so this kind of format is unfamiliar. Midterm poorly reflected the "lecture content", but the papers were graded fairly.

This class certainly had the potential to be interesting, but it was not. I did not learn a thing about bioethics. The textbook used was a pure ethics textbook and did not relate to bioethics. His expectations are extremely unclear for tests and papers. The live classes had no structure. By the end of the semester he became really rude.

Very nice person but his course was a MESS. Lectures were one long rambling convrsation, with unclear connections to class content. Midterm was super hard and did not relate to what he taught. Almost never at his office hrs (held an O.H. while he was out on a run) and would reply to emails a week later. Provided bonus mrk assignment which was nice.

Midterm was tricky. Expectations unclear. Opportunities for bonus marks exist, but they're time-consuming. Near the end of the term, he was more impatient answering questions, which made the final exam all the more difficult and bothersome to complete. Just do everything you can to take bioethics with a diff prof.

He really got rude in the end in my opinion. At first he showed so much empathy and patience and understanding of a student, but as soon as that final came he got aggressive in his tone he used with us. No need to embarrass and ridicule students in front of a whole class and the blame of organization with bonus points is a you problem, not us Dr.M.
Very unclear with instructions for the position paper. The midterm was extremely hard and did not care. Hard to watch lectures.

BEWARE of this prof! Never answers emails and hangs up on you after two minutes during office hours because there are too many students.  The grading is extremely harsh on papers and doesn't even make sense. Instructions are unclear for everything. His midterm had so many questions on it that were not covered. Textbook and lectures are useless.

This is the worst course I've ever taken thanks to McK*nna. He didn't provide any instructions for the position paper or final exam. He didn't post the rubric for the final exam until 2 days before it was due, leaving many students confused and unsure of his expectations. He also tells his TAs to be super harsh with grading (according to a TA).

This class was so unnecessarily difficult. The prof went on long tangents during class time - completely unrelated to class content. He did not prepare us for the one midterm, gave no guidance for the exams and paper and was unreachable by email. Instructions are so unclear and it's not like he does anything to help. Terrible class. Do not take.

After we had our midterm in Feb, his lectures became unstructured. Going to class a waste of my time. The only reason I didn't drop the course was because it was mandatory. If you like a strucutred class with clear instructions and helpful material, do yourself a favor and take another prof. DON'T TAKE HIM AT ALL COSTS!!!

His class is not structured - it's just him going on long rants and tangents (2+ hours sometimes) that aren't at all useful to learning the course material. His multiple choice exams were unnecessarily difficult. Oh and he wants us to write questions for him to use in his test bank next year... does this not count as slavery?

If this class wasn't mandatory I would have dropped it. The textbook was so poorly written and not relevant to bioethics - it was ridiculous. Lectures are not structured and half the time we don't even talk about the material. He seems like a nice person but I disliked his class so much. Assignment instructions left me confused all the time.

Took him during covid 19. Honestly, he has a good heart, but the way he taught in this pandemic was not for me. He made breakout rooms constantly which did not help me. He has flexibility with deadlines but is not clear with what he wants for is case study assignments. I would not take his class again

Very good prof! Considerate that we have other classes and always willing to extend deadlines. He brought different headphones, laptops, routers, etc. to try and make his zoom classes the best he could even with poor internet. Small assignments/quizzes due every week that are an easy 30%, a midterm, case study, and a final (case study)

Made zoom classes interesting and he showed us his chickens. Gotta do all the readings or else don't expect a very high grade. Overall an easy course but get ready do have small assignments/quiz every week. (This class is online during corona so idk how his classes are in person)
Didn't like his bioethics class. We had concepts on the first midterm that were never assigned. Not very clear expectations. Overall, this course was poorly organized.

This guy's so funny and probably the realest prof I've ever had. Bioethics was super interesting but you gotta do all the readings (can be very dry) and participate in class to make the most of it. He's really good at leading discussions and gets you to think critically about ethical issues. Got 100% on the take-home final which was a case study.

Boring material. Useless slides. Lots of reading. Very easy midterms if you do reading - mc and short answers. Participation is free 10%. Final is take-home paper that was easy but haven't received marks yet.
He was probably good in the past, but he was the worst this year.
Amazing professor, he made ethics interesting. Would 100% take a class with him again!!
Great prof! Very entertaining, loves class discussions. Midterms and final are very fair. Readings can be intense but he explains them well.
Hilarious prof. Super charismatic and interesting. Midterms and final are all set up the same way. Really takes students' ideas into account.
Iain Mckenna has to be by far my favourite prof at uOttawa, his lectures are so interesting and he is so funny but yet such a down to earth prof.
McKenna is a solid choice for bioethics. He asks us what to put on the exam and loves in-class debates. Made the course so much easier than it would've been. Keep being a gem McKenna
Professor McKenna is amazing, he cares about what he teaches and makes it interesting.
Love this professor! His lectures are so interesting and the topics are never ever dull! He is also very sweet and cares for his students

He's a really fun prof. The discussions were great and the guy is mad smart. Tests were chill, but there's A LOT of reading. However, he doesn't test the details too much, just understand the concepts, keep up with the chapters and you're gold.

Prof McKenna was outstanding. He treats students like equals, talks rather than lectures, and still gets the course content across fantastically. He brought in some of the most interesting guest speakers I've ever experienced from a variety of fields. Readings were pretty compulsory but the textbook reads very easily. Would definitely take again.
great prof!
Professor McKenna was a great professor, almost missed him, got lucky for having him in PHI2397.

Very straightforward professor. He provides us questions on the midterm/final beforehand and will not trick you. The final consisted of essay questions but he allowed us to bring in cheat sheets and expected us to basically write the essays at home first then rewrite it in the final room.

You have to read a chapter each week and write a quick summary for participation marks. You didn't really have to attend since he posted the slides on BlackBoard. Overall his test were very straightforward (gave us the question in advance) but the exam required a lot of preparation. Overall a nice prof that understands students.
In most of his classes, you submit a one page summary every class of the readings. He makes his expectations exceptionally clear. He is a dynamic lecturer, and a fantastic professor!

Very personable prof. Cares about his students and does not shy away from thoughtful conversations. I took his Ethics class so perhaps that catered more towards participatory classes but still interesting. There were assignments to be handed in before each class which counted as participation points and there was group presentations. Good prof!

Pretty simple class with an interactive component. Has the difficulty of a high school course, so I couldn't worry about consulting the professor for help. He seemed pretty available from the multitude of emails he would send out.
His personality is simply amazing! Although a lot of reading is required, but he will give you the questions before the exams to prepare, so it's pretty fair. AMAZING CLASS:)

Super cool prof. Rocks all kinds of bow ties. Great sense of humour. He is always ready to help out his students in every way possible and is always open to ideas from his students. That being said, expect A LOT of work and reading in this course. The course content is pretty dry (especially if you don't like politics) and lectures can be long.

Great professor and great class. He's very open to suggestions and is flexible with deadlines. He's also knowledgeable in this subject and makes it interesting. This class is mostly a big discussion group on different topics of ethics in IR, so make sure to read the book. Not a lot of assignments, but participation is important.

Okay, seriously he is the best prof I have EVER had. He's open to dialogue about projects, clear in course requirements, and he treats you like an equal instead of a lowly student. He values students' input and collaborates with to be fair about the course material; yet he's not a pushover. Reasonable, and gave an extension for the final. A+ prof.

Professor McKenna is a class act.  His teaching is fun and engaging.   He is very democratic,  allowing students to decide on projects and grading schemes.   I liked his approach to classroom discussion.  I would highly recommend him and his excellent bowties.

Professor McKenna is a class act.  He teaches very democratically, responds quickly to e-mails and is a really cool guy in general.  He engages the class, even if the subject is initially foreign to you.   He rocks bow ties.  I would highly recommend him.

Hands down the best professor I've had at this university. He makes you really think about why you have specific opinions. You learn a lot and delve into a lot of philosophy in an applicable way. Really recommend this to anyone who likes a looser class structure and a lot of discussion.

awesome prof!! I highly recommend taking his course. He truly cares about his students and actually makes class fun and interesting! Not to mention he's hilarious! If you put the effort in, you will do well! You get exam questions before hand and also allowed a cheat cheat on exams

Great prof. Interesting class. Responded to his emails quickly and very clear with what he wants from his students. I had problems with technical difficulties at times and he is very understanding with his students.

Great Course. Appropriate work load. Loved the different assignment styles-I.e xtranormal,merer rant...etc It made the course more fun to learn,which always makes learning easier. I learnt a lot from this course and would recommend it to others. Prof very helpful and got back to me very quickly with answers to my questions. Very interactive course.

My first online course! Very creative prof (creative in that we didn't just have papers due, but video rants, computer animated debates, etc.) The workload was a bit much and I think the assignment weighting was off a bit. But prof is clear and involved and the assignments are directly related to the readings, so it's really really hard to fail.

I put attendance as mandatory because although we never had to meet in person (online course) we did have an assignment due every second night and comments due every night in between assignments on other students work for  participation marks. You can not slack off all week and cram it in on weekends. You must do your homework nightly. Great course

Straight forward course. I think everyone should learn more about the country you are living it. Some of the reading is VERY MIND NUMBING!! It's not the content that's boring, it's the author and their style of writing. I recommend the professor to select more readings from authours like Michael Adams, which I enjoy reading.
Great professor! He really wants you to succeed in his class. He effectively communicates his expectations and offers prompt feedback/information :)!
Amazing and extremely chill prof who takes students' opinions into consideration. Lectures are like discussion groups and really compliment the textbook.

Funny, witty, super-nerdy smart. Great prof, one of the best at uOttawa. I've had him for 2 classes and in both scored an A but had to work for it - and he is super reasonable. Lets you choose what kind of exam we write (in class or take home). Lets the students be involved in how we are tested. Highly recommended!
Nerdy hot and cares about students.  He gives questions ahead of time and his exams are pretty fair.  Great class!
I'd drop it like it's hot! Liked the course too...
Dude rocks.  Knows his stuff and encourages class discussion.
My favorite prof by far. Great teacher and gives fair exams.
Last reviewer is clearly a top student who understands how to read a syllabus. It makes perfect sense to stay in a class that one hates. Great prof and in my view, great class.
Interesting class discussions and selected readings are informative. Excellent lectures about selected readings

Had him for intro to Canadian Studies.  First off, he looks like Toby McGuire, its so funny.  Couldnt get enough of his class, knows his stuff, and challenges you to think.  Willing to listen to all viewpoints.  Engages his class big time.  Very fair.  I need to retake PHI1101 and I am praying to God that this man is my professor.  Awesome guy!!!!!

He is such a good professor. His lectures are always interesting and he makes an effort to discuss the lectures with the class. He asks the students for exam questions that he uses on the exams. He is very clear and is quick to answer questions. He is a very fair marker and his exams are fairly easy.

Such a cutie! You can tell he cares about his class, and he really wants them to learn and be interested. I am NOT a huge fan of philosophy, but it was a mandatory course and it ended up being VERY interesting with his teaching techniques. As long as you keep up with the material, you can't do bad in his class! I Definitely recommend him!
Amazing prof. Very interesting and helpful. Take his class!

very easy course with this teacher! I never read one of the articles and managed to ace the tests. Although he talks way to much and the classes get boring, his use of virtual campus is very very helpful. Pretty much, its obvious he's a nice guy
Prof McKenna was SO adorable!! I will miss his class such a great prof for PHI because he doesn't make the material overwhelming or boring! definately recommend him! He is amazingly sweet too!

I ADORED him!I was worried about the material being boring but I LOVED it!He really made it a)fun b)showed you examples(movies and experiments and stuff)and just picked really interesting topics.Didn't have to buy textbooks-he put them online aka, saving us alot of money!!:D Gave study questions then composed tests out of them.KEEP HIM TEACHING!!<3
Easy Prof. Great Guy, take his class. The material is whack but if you can memorize the study question answers then you are set because those are what he puts on the midterms and final exam.
Great lectures. Super nice. Gives questions before the test.
Keep this prof teaching this class! Love this guy.
Enthusiastic and cares about teaching students. The class is hard but is worth taking.
My favorite Prof.
Gives you questions for tests ahead of time. YOU MUST STUDY THESE OR YOU WILL FAIL! That said, he is really nice and always willing to help. Plus he shows movies in class. Great Prof.
He is a great lecturer and his tests are pretty fair. Plus he's cute and a nice guy.

Well the guy knows his stuff for sure. REALLY need to read the book and come to class though. He's good at clarifying, can be really funny at times and seems like an overall nice person. Lectures were dry, I won't lie about that but, that's probably because he talks in a mellow voice sometimes AND the classes were at 8:30. Good prof though!

Made the mistake of getting behind in lectures and reading: NOT A GOOD IDEA. Was a great prof, very nerdy-hot and extremely insightful. Not good for 8:30 AM classes as some lectures and all slides will put you to sleep on cue.
i just switched a second year class from a reasonable time to early classes so i could be in his section. greatest prof ever. he actually cares about teaching and about the students. take him
Prof McKenna is so cute. He can get boring but insightful.
Great professor. I love his lectures, but id like it if he let us off attendance sometimes.
gr8 prof!
Awesome prof. Really helpful and flexible, makes dry material easy to understand.

Took Critical thinking and enviro. ethics with this guy in the same semester and overall I thought he was good. A few moments in both classes where I thought his inexperience showed a little, but he was usually pretty clear and was obviously passionate about his work. In a few years this guy will knock anyone's socks off, I'm sure.

the classes were slowly paced, but that helped near the end of the course. also he has a really cute kid who was sick one day and came to class with him. super nice guy, super reasonable, pretty cute!
Here is a guy who actually cares about teaching.  He is really passionate about the material.
Really thorough with his lectures. Pretty helpful outside of class and pretty good looking too!
Awsome prof!  I plan on taking all of his courses!  My favorite class.
My favorite prof. yet.  Take his class if you get a chance.
Nice guy and very fair.  He is really passionate about ethics and wants people to learn.  People who complain about their marks are missing the point of courses like his.  Great Prof!
Posts great test reviews online.  Willing to accommodate students.  Nice guy great prof.
Love his course.  Makes it worth getting for 8:30 class.
My favorite class.
Looked forward to his classes.  Makes material intersting and useful.  Good prof.
Not so hard.  Good class.
Knows his stuff.  Will teach it to you if you are willing to learn.  Not an easy course but worth taking.  Plus he is really hot!
Great teacher.  Not an easy course but you will learn a lot.

He's a really good teacher to have, but if you are just looking for a high mark and you just felt like choosing one of his PHI classes. DON'T YOU WILL REGRET. <--- I'm only saying this for the people that just want a good mark and are to lazy to read the text book.

I really don't understand why he has so many poor ratings. His assignments and exams are very clear as to what he's expecting, he's quite specific but as long as you follow his guidelines you won't have a problem. He is one of the nicest profs I've had. All of the poor ratings honestly made me so nervous to take this class but I'm so glad I did.

Amazing prof, one of the nicest people out there. His assignments are marked fairly, I'm in Science and haven't written a paper in my life but got all A's . People who are trashing him here are just salty they got failed cos of plagiarism, which he is very strict about

I really liked this class. The material was really interesting, and the prof conveyed the material very well too. However, for some reason, McCuaig asks his T.A. to mark us harshly. That being said, it was very difficult to get anything over a B+ in this class. This class had a midterm, a song analysis, a final paper, and a final exam.

The professor himself is fine. Straightforward lectures and responds quickly to emails and accommodation requests. HOWEVER, his TAs mark extremely harshly. Unlike the other reviews here I took his course before 2021 so it's probably Keith instructing the TAs to reduce the class average every semester rather than bad TAs for a specific semester.

The prof is not too bad, he replies emails and is helpful if you reach out. His classes are engaging. HOWEVER, do not take this course as an elective, the marking criteria and the TAs are actually demons from hell! You will have to work SO hard for a second year course just to make sure it doesn't plummet your GPA.

I really enjoyed this class! The prof was organized and presented the class material very well. I always looked forward to going to class. However, the TA was pretty tough (maybe tougher than what was fair). Keep in mind that this class is not an easy A, so don't take it if that's what you're looking for.

Professor McCuaig is one of the few professors I've had the pleasure of learning from that genuinely cares for his student's wellbeing. He made the course extremely enjoyable, engaging and easy to comprehend. Assignment expectations were very clearly stated and if there were any questions that needed to be answered he answered them quickly
A great professor who is very clearly passionate about what he's teaching. He really knows the content and presents it in a super interesting way. You won't regret taking a class with him!
One of the worst profs I've had so far. Doesn't answer questions and is very rude with students. The workload is really heavy. If this lab is not mandatory for you avoid it at all cost.

The lab itself was manageable but you are MAINLY interacting with TAs not Dr. Poitras. Lots of components to the grade: weekly readings + assignments, lab notebook, lab quizzes (participation), draft reports, final report, practical exam, and final exam. It is a pretty heavy course in-terms of workload. Final was difficult but doable with studying.
He is unhelpful/vague during office hours. Has a very flawed teaching and grading method.

I would rather take another course instead of taking Dr. Luc as my prof. again. He was really rude in his emails. He seemed that I wasted his time. I think my time is more precious than his. He should really be more polite with students
He is not the right professor to be in this course
